definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Were you aware he was ball-deep in some Washington wonk ?
sentences.chinese: 你知道他和华盛顿的一个书呆子有染吗？

sentences.english: The egghead in the university knows nothing about business.
sentences.chinese: 大学里的书呆子对生意一窍不通。

sentences.english: But self-described nerd Kenta Asata, said the wait was worth it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，自描述的书呆子健太朝多说，等待是值得的。

sentences.english: And why don't you resolve to stop being a dork?
sentences.chinese: 那你为什么不决心不再做一个呆子呢？

sentences.english: Dance with you, even if he feels like a dork.
sentences.chinese: 和你跳舞，即使他感觉自己像个呆子。

sentences.english: In spite of her love of reading she denied being an egghead .
sentences.chinese: 尽管她爱好阅读，但她不认为自己是个书呆子。

sentences.english: Michael Lopp: Nerds are system thinkers.
sentences.chinese: 书呆子们就是系统思考者。

sentences.english: It filled my nerdy side with joy, and I downloaded all of the issues.
sentences.chinese: 这太让我这个书呆子高兴了，我把每期都下载了下来。

sentences.english: Be nice to nerds . Chances are you'll end up working for one.
sentences.chinese: 成为书呆子很好，机遇以你为什么工作的方式而告终。

sentences.english: I can't date a dork like him!
sentences.chinese: 我不会跟像他这样的书呆子约会。

sentences.english: That’s how a nerd copes with first-date anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 这就是书呆子应对第一次约会的方法。

sentences.english: Last, nerds are  more powerful than we know.
sentences.chinese: 最后，书呆子是比我们想象中更强大。

sentences.english: For example: John is such an egghead, he should get out more and enjoy himself。
sentences.chinese: 约翰都快成书呆子了，他应该多出去转转，放松一下。

sentences.english: Also, nerds get a high out of building stuff.
sentences.chinese: 书呆子们在建设某种东西的过程中自得其乐。

sentences.english: Bookish bachelor seeking single Noetic Scientist?
sentences.chinese: 书呆子单身汉在追求单身的抽象的科学家？

sentences.english: Go to the library on weekends? You are a certifiable bookworm.
sentences.chinese: 周末还去图书馆？你真是一个无可救药的书呆子。

definition: lit. pale-faced scholar (idiom); young and inexperienced person without practical experience/still wet behind the ears
unable to understand/can't get the point
